resources.string: Scarica file (non disponibile per download con un solo file)
Scarica file (disponibile solo sui download BitTorrent)
Scarica file (disponibile solo quando il download è in pausa)
Scarica i file nella cartella (disponibile solo quando il download è in pausa)
Scarica file nella cartella (disponibile solo sui download BitTorrent)
Scarica file nella cartella (non disponibile per download con un solo file)
Abilita animazioni nella lista dei files
Le animazioni sono abilitate (L\'applicazione potrette crashare o non funzionare correttamente con liste molto lunghe)
Frequenza di aggiornamento della lista download
Frequenza di aggiornamento della lista download in secondi
Se un azione su un download fallisce, sarà frozata
Se un azione su un download fallisce, non succederà nulla
Selezioni quali tipi di notifiche da ricevere

string-array.name: bt_max_peers
string-array.item: Specify the maximum number of peers per torrent. 0 means unlimited.

string-array.name: bt_remove_unselected_file
string-array.item: Removes the unselected files when download is completed in BitTorrent. Please use this option with care because it will actually remove files from your disk.

string-array.name: bt_request_peer_speed_limit
string-array.item: If the whole download speed of every torrent is lower than this value, aria2 temporarily increases the number of peers to try for more download speed. Configuring this option with your preferred download speed can increase your download speed in some cases.

string-array.name: force_save
string-array.item: Save download even if the download is completed or removed. This option also saves control file in that situations. This may be useful to save BitTorrent seeding which is recognized as completed state.

string-array.name: max_download_limit
string-array.item: Set max download speed per each download in bytes/sec. 0 means unrestricted.

string-array.name: max_upload_limit
string-array.item: Set max upload speed per each torrent in bytes/sec. 0 means unrestricted.

string-array.name: all_proxy
string-array.item: Use a proxy server for all protocols. To override a previously defined proxy, use "". This affects all downloads. The format of PROXY is [http://][USER:PASSWORD@]HOST[:PORT]

string-array.name: all_proxy_passwd
string-array.item: Set password for all proxy option.

string-array.name: all_proxy_user
string-array.item: Set user for all proxy option.

string-array.name: allow_overwrite
string-array.item: Restart download from scratch if the corresponding control file doesn\'t exist.

string-array.name: allow_piece_length_change
string-array.item: If false is given, aria2 aborts download when a piece length is different from one in a control file. If true is given, you can proceed but some download progress will be lost.

string-array.name: always_resume
string-array.item: If true is given, aria2 always tries to resume download and if resume is not possible, aborts download. If false is given, when all given URIs do not support resume or aria2 encounters N URIs which does not support resume (N is max resume failure tries option), aria2 downloads file from scratch.

string-array.name: auto_file_renaming
string-array.item: Rename file name if the same file already exists. This option works only in HTTP(S)/FTP download. The new file name has a dot and a number(1..9999) appended.

string-array.name: bt_enable_lpd
string-array.item: If a private flag is set in a torrent, aria2 doesn\'t use this feature for that download even if true is given.

string-array.name: bt_exclude_tracker
string-array.item: Comma separated list of BitTorrent tracker\'s announce URI to remove. You can use special value * which matches all URIs, thus removes all announce URIs. When specifying * in shell command-line, don\'t forget to escape or quote it.

string-array.name: bt_external_ip
string-array.item: Specify the external IP address to report to a BitTorrent tracker. Although this function is named external, it can accept any kind of IP addresses. Value must be a numeric IP address.

string-array.name: bt_hash_check_seed
string-array.item: If true is given, after hash check using check integrity option and file is complete, continue to seed file. If you want to check file and download it only when it is damaged or incomplete, set this option to false. This option has effect only on BitTorrent download.

string-array.name: bt_max_open_files
string-array.item: Specify maximum number of files to open in multi-file BitTorrent/Metalink download globally.

string-array.name: bt_metadata_only
string-array.item: The file(s) described in meta data will not be downloaded. This option has effect only when BitTorrent Magnet URI is used.

string-array.name: bt_min_crypto_level
string-array.item: Set minimum level of encryption method. If several encryption methods are provided by a peer, aria2 chooses the lowest one which satisfies the given level.

string-array.name: bt_prioritize_piece
string-array.item: This is useful for previewing files. The argument can contain 2 keywords: head and tail. To include both keywords, they must be separated by comma. These keywords can take one parameter, SIZE. For example, if head=SIZE is specified, pieces in the range of first SIZE bytes of each file get higher priority. tail=SIZE means the range of last SIZE bytes of each file.

string-array.name: bt_require_crypto
string-array.item: If true is given, aria2 doesn\'t accept and establish connection with legacy BitTorrent handshake(\19BitTorrent protocol). Thus aria2 always uses Obfuscation handshake.

string-array.name: bt_save_metadata
string-array.item: This option has effect only when BitTorrent Magnet URI is used. The file name is hex encoded info hash with suffix ".torrent". The directory to be saved is the same directory where download file is saved. If the same file already exists, meta data is not saved.

string-array.name: bt_seed_unverified
string-array.item: Seed previously downloaded files without verifying piece hashes.

string-array.name: bt_stop_timeout
string-array.item: Stop BitTorrent download if download speed is 0 in consecutive SEC seconds. If 0 is given, this feature is disabled.

string-array.name: bt_tracker
string-array.item: Comma separated list of additional BitTorrent tracker\'s announce URI. These URIs are not affected by exclude tracker option because they are added after URIs in exclude tracker option are removed.

string-array.name: bt_tracker_connect_timeout
string-array.item: Set the connect timeout in seconds to establish connection to tracker. After the connection is established, this option makes no effect and tracker timeout option is used instead.

string-array.name: bt_tracker_interval
string-array.item: Set the interval in seconds between tracker requests. This completely overrides interval value and aria2 just uses this value and ignores the min interval and interval value in the response of tracker. If 0 is set, aria2 determines interval based on the response of tracker and the download progress.

string-array.name: check_integrity
string-array.item: Check file integrity by validating piece hashes or a hash of entire file. This option has effect only in BitTorrent, Metalink downloads with checksums or HTTP(S)/FTP downloads with checksum option. If piece hashes are provided, this option can detect damaged portions of a file and re-download them. If a hash of entire file is provided, hash check is only done when file has been already download. This is determined by file length. If hash check fails, file is re-downloaded from scratch. If both piece hashes and a hash of entire file are provided, only piece hashes are used.

string-array.name: conditional_get
string-array.item: Download file only when the local file is older than remote file. This function only works with HTTP(S) downloads only. It does not work if file size is specified in Metalink. It also ignores Content-Disposition header. If a control file exists, this option will be ignored. This function uses If-Modified-Since header to get only newer file conditionally. When getting modification time of local file, it uses user supplied file name or file name part in URI if out option is not specified. To overwrite existing file, allow overwrite is required.

string-array.name: connect_timeout
string-array.item: Set the connect timeout in seconds to establish connection to HTTP/FTP/proxy server. After the connection is established, this option makes no effect and timeout option is used instead.

string-array.name: continuee
string-array.item: Continue downloading a partially downloaded file. Use this option to resume a download started by a web browser or another program which downloads files sequentially from the beginning. Currently this option is only applicable to HTTP(S)/FTP downloads.

string-array.name: dir
string-array.item: The directory to store the downloaded file.

string-array.name: enable_async_dns6
string-array.item: Enable IPv6 resolution in async DNS
Enable IPv6 name resolution in asynchronous DNS resolver. This option will be ignored when async dns option is false.

string-array.name: enable_peer_exchange
string-array.item: If a private flag is set in a torrent, this feature is disabled for that download even if true is given.

string-array.name: file_allocation
string-array.item: None doesn\'t pre-allocate file space. prealloc pre-allocates file space before download begins. This may take some time depending on the size of the file. If you are using newer file systems such as ext4 (with extents support), btrfs, xfs or NTFS(MinGW build only), falloc is your best choice. It allocates large(few GiB) files almost instantly. Don\'t use falloc with legacy file systems such as ext3 and FAT32 because it takes almost same time as prealloc and it blocks aria2 entirely until allocation finishes. falloc may not be available if your system doesn\'t have posix_fallocate(3) function.

string-array.name: follow_metalink
string-array.item: If true or mem is specified, when a file whose suffix is .meta4 or .metalink or content type of application/metalink4+xml or application/metalink+xml is downloaded, aria2 parses it as a metalink file and downloads files mentioned in it. If mem is specified, a metalink file is not written to the disk, but is just kept in memory. If false is specified, the action mentioned above is not taken.

string-array.name: follow_torrent
string-array.item: If true or mem is specified, when a file whose suffix is .torrent or content type is application/x-bittorrent is downloaded, aria2 parses it as a torrent file and downloads files mentioned in it. If mem is specified, a torrent file is not written to the disk, but is just kept in memory. If false is specified, the action mentioned above is not taken.

string-array.name: ftp_passwd
string-array.item: This affects all URIs. If user name is embedded but password is missing in URI, aria2 tries to resolve password using .netrc. If password is found in .netrc, then use it as password. If not, use the password specified in this option.

string-array.name: ftp_pasv
string-array.item: If false is given, the active mode will be used.

string-array.name: ftp_proxy
string-array.item: To erase previously defined proxy, use "". This affects all URIs. The format of PROXY is [http://][USER:PASSWORD@]HOST[:PORT].

string-array.name: ftp_proxy_passwd
string-array.item: Set password for ftp proxy option.

string-array.name: ftp_proxy_user
string-array.item: Set user for ftp proxy option.

string-array.name: ftp_type
string-array.item: Type is either binary or ascii.

string-array.name: header
string-array.item: Append HEADER to HTTP request header.

string-array.name: http_accept_gzip
string-array.item: Send Accept: deflate, gzip request header and inflate response if remote server responds with Content-Encoding: gzip or Content-Encoding: deflate.

string-array.name: http_auth_challenge
string-array.item: Send authorization header only if requested

Send HTTP authorization header only when it is requested by the server. If false is set, then authorization header is always sent to the server. There is an exception: if username and password are embedded in URI, authorization header is always sent to the server regardless of this option.

string-array.name: http_no_cache
string-array.item: Send Cache-Control: no-cache and Pragma: no-cache header to avoid cached content. If false is given, these headers are not sent and you can add Cache-Control header with a directive you like using header option.

string-array.name: http_proxy
string-array.item: Use this proxy server for HTTP. To erase previously defined proxy, use "". This affects all URIs. The format of PROXY is [http://][USER:PASSWORD@]HOST[:PORT].

string-array.name: http_proxy_passwd
string-array.item: Set password for http proxy option.

string-array.name: http_proxy_user
string-array.item: Set user for http proxy option.

string-array.name: index_out
string-array.item: Set file path for specified file

Set file path for file with index=INDEX. You can find the file index using the show files option. PATH is a relative path to the path specified in dir option. You can use this option multiple times. Using this option, you can specify the output filenames of BitTorrent downloads.

string-array.name: lowest_speed_limit
string-array.item: Close connection if speed is lower than
Close connection if download speed is lower than or equal to this value(bytes per sec). 0 means aria2 does not have a lowest speed limit. This option does not affect BitTorrent downloads.

string-array.name: max_connection_per_server
string-array.item: The maximum number of connections to one server for each download.

string-array.name: max_file_not_found
string-array.item: Number of fails to stop download

If aria2 receives "file not found" status from the remote HTTP/FTP servers NUM times without getting a single byte, then force the download to fail. Specify 0 to disable this option. This options is effective only when using HTTP/FTP servers.

string-array.name: max_resume_failure_tries
string-array.item: Number of resume fails to stop download

When used with always resume option is false, aria2 downloads file from scratch when aria2 detects N number of URIs that does not support resume. If N is 0, aria2 downloads file from scratch when all given URIs do not support resume.

string-array.name: max_tries
string-array.item: Set number of tries. 0 means unlimited.

string-array.name: metalink_enable_unique_protocol
string-array.item: If true is given and several protocols are available for a mirror in a metalink file, aria2 uses one of them. Use metalink preferred protocol option to specify the preference of protocol.

string-array.name: metalink_language
string-array.item: The language of the file to download.

string-array.name: metalink_location
string-array.item: The location of the preferred server. A comma-delimited list of locations is acceptable, for example, jp,us.

string-array.name: metalink_os
string-array.item: The operating system of the file to download.

string-array.name: metalink_version
string-array.item: The version of the file to download.

string-array.name: min_split_size
string-array.item: aria2 does not split less than 2*SIZE byte range. For example, let\'s consider downloading 20MiB file. If SIZE is 10M, aria2 can split file into 2 range [0\-10MiB] and [10MiB\-20MiB] and download it using 2 sources(if split option >= 2, of course). If SIZE is 15M, since 2*15M > 20MiB, aria2 does not split file and download it using 1 source. Possible Values: 1Mb to 1024Mb

string-array.name: no_file_allocation_limit
string-array.item: No file allocation is made for files whose size is smaller than value.

string-array.name: no_netrc
string-array.item: Netrc support is enabled by default. Note netrc file is only read at the startup if option is false. So if option is true at the startup, no netrc is available throughout the session. You cannot get netrc enabled even if you change this setting.

string-array.name: no_proxy
string-array.item: Specify comma separated hostnames, domains and network address with or without CIDR block where proxy should not be used.

string-array.name: out
string-array.item: When force sequential option is used, this option is ignored.

string-array.name: proxy_method
string-array.item: HTTPS downloads always use tunnel regardless of this option.

string-array.name: realtime_chunk_checksum
string-array.item: Validate chunk of data by calculating checksum while downloading a file if chunk checksums are provided.

string-array.name: remote_time
string-array.item: Retrieve timestamp of the remote file from the remote HTTP/FTP server and if it is available, apply it to the local file.

string-array.name: remove_control_file
string-array.item: Remove control file before download. Using with allow overwrite option is true, download always starts from scratch. This will be useful for users behind proxy server which disables resume.

string-array.name: seed_ratio
string-array.item: Seed completed torrents until share ratio reaches RATIO. You are strongly encouraged to specify equals or more than 1.0 here. Specify 0.0 if you intend to do seeding regardless of share ratio. If seed time option is specified along with this option, seeding ends when at least one of the conditions is satisfied.

string-array.name: seed_time
string-array.item: Specify seeding time in minutes. Specifying 0 disables seeding after download completed.

string-array.name: select_file
string-array.item: Set file to download by its index.

You can find the file index using the show files option. Multiple indexes can be specified by using comma for example: 3,6. You can also use \- to specify a range: 1\-5, and \- can be used together: 1\-5,8,9.

string-array.name: split
string-array.item: If more than N URIs are given, first N URIs are used and remaining URIs are used for backup. If less than N URIs are given, those URIs are used more than once so that N connections total are made simultaneously. The number of connections to the same host is restricted by max connection per server option.

string-array.name: use_head
string-array.item: Use HEAD method for the first request to the HTTP server.

string-array.name: user_agent
string-array.item: Set user agent for HTTP(S) downloads. Default: aria2/$VERSION, $VERSION is replaced by package version.

string-array.name: retry_wait
string-array.item: With value > 0, aria2 will retry download when the HTTP server returns 503 response.

string-array.name: stream_piece_selector
string-array.item: Specify piece selection algorithm used in HTTP/FTP download. Piece means fixed length segment which is downloaded in parallel in segmented download. If default is given, aria2 selects piece so that it reduces the number of establishing connection. This is reasonable default behaviour because establishing connection is an expensive operation. If inorder is given, aria2 selects piece which has minimum index. Index=0 means first of the file. This will be useful to view movie while downloading it. Enable http pipelining option may be useful to reduce reconnection overhead. Please note that aria2 honors min split size option, so it will be necessary to specify a reasonable value to min split size option. If geom is given, at the beginning aria2 selects piece which has minimum index like inorder, but it exponentially increasingly keeps space from previously selected piece. This will reduce the number of establishing connection and at the same time it will download the beginning part of the file first. This will be useful to view movie while downloading it.

string-array.name: hash_check_only
string-array.item: If true is given, after hash check using check integrity option, abort download whether or not download is complete.

string-array.name: checksum
string-array.item: TYPE is hash type. The supported hash type is listed in Hash Algorithms in aria2c -v. DIGEST is hex digest. For example, setting sha-1 digest looks like this: sha-1=0192ba11326fe2298c8cb4de616f4d4140213838 This option applies only to HTTP(S)/FTP downloads.

string-array.name: uri_selector
string-array.item: The possible values are inorder, feedback and adaptive. If inorder is given, URI is tried in the order appeared in the URI list. If feedback is given, aria2 uses download speed observed in the previous downloads and choose fastest server in the URI list. This also effectively skips dead mirrors. The observed download speed is a part of performance profile of servers mentioned in server stat of and server stat if options. If adaptive is given, selects one of the best mirrors for the first and reserved connections. For supplementary ones, it returns mirrors which has not been tested yet, and if each of them has already been tested, returns mirrors which has to be tested again. Otherwise, it doesn\'t select anymore mirrors. Like feedback, it uses a performance profile of servers.

string-array.name: log
string-array.item: If - is specified, log is written to stdout. If empty string("") is specified, or this option is omitted, no log is written to disk at all.

string-array.name: max_concurrent_downloads
string-array.item: Set the maximum number of parallel downloads for every queue item.

string-array.name: max_download_result
string-array.item: The download results are completed/error/removed downloads. The download results are stored in FIFO queue and it can store at most NUM download results. When queue is full and new download result is created, oldest download result is removed from the front of the queue and new one is pushed to the back. Setting big number in this option may result high memory consumption after thousands of downloads. Specifying 0 means no download result is kept.

string-array.name: max_overall_download_limit
string-array.item: Set max overall download speed in bytes/sec. 0 means unrestricted.

string-array.name: max_overall_upload_limit
string-array.item: Set max overall upload speed in bytes/sec. 0 means unrestricted.

string-array.name: optimize_concurrent_downloads
string-array.item: Optimizes the number of concurrent downloads according to the bandwidth available. aria2 uses the download speed observed in the previous downloads to adapt the number of downloads launched in parallel according to the rule N = A + B Log10(speed in Mbps). The coefficients A and B can be customized in the option arguments with A and B separated by a colon. The default values (A=5, B=25) lead to using typically 5 parallel downloads on 1Mbps networks and above 50 on 100Mbps networks. The number of parallel downloads remains constrained under the maximum defined by the max concurrent downloads parameter.

string-array.name: save_cookies
string-array.item: Save Cookies to FILE in Mozilla/Firefox(1.x/2.x)/ Netscape format. If FILE already exists, it is overwritten. Session Cookies are also saved and their expiry values are treated as 0.

string-array.name: save_session
string-array.item: Save error/unfinished downloads to FILE on exit. If you like the output to be gzipped append a .gz extension to the file name. Please note that downloads added by aria2.addTorrent() and aria2.addMetalink() RPC method and whose meta data could not be saved as a file are not saved. Downloads removed using aria2.remove() and aria2.forceRemove() will not be saved.

string-array.name: server_stat_of
string-array.item: Specify the file name to which performance profile of the servers is saved. You can load saved data using server stat of option. See Server Performance Profile subsection below for file format.

resources.string: L\'applicazione ha bisogno di accedere ai dati del cellulare per verificare la licenza di Google. Verrà visualizzato un messaggio.
Il servizio di notifica sarà sempre attivo
Il servizio di notifica potrebbe riportare notifiche non in tempo reale o non funzionare correttamente

Aria2App utilizza l\'interfaccia JSON-RPC di aria2! È supportato solo il metodo di autenticazione attraverso token. Leggi https://aria2.github.io/manual/en/html/aria2c.html#rpc-interface per saperne di più!
Sviluppatore: Gianlu (Riportare bug o qualsiasi suggerimento)
Modalità multipla (utilizza differenti indirizzi per differenti condizioni di connessione)
Modalità singola (utilizza lo stesso indirizzo per tutte le connessioni)

DirectDownload ti permette di scaricare direttamente i file dal server aria2 sul tuo dispositivo con un singolo tap! Hai solo bisogno di una configurazione appropriata del server. Per esempio: https://docs.python.org/2/library/simplehttpserver.html
L\'indirizzo dovrebbe puntare alla cartella di download di aria2.
Questo server è attualmente offline. Vuoi utilizzarlo comunque?
Il download di questo file non è ancora terminato! Vuoi scaricarlo comunque su questo dispositivo?
L\'applicazione ha bisogno di scrivere la memoria per scaricare i file! Verrà visualizzato un messaggio.
Tutti gli URI devono puntare alla stessa risorsa altrimenti il download potrebbe fallire od essere corrotto senza il reclamo di aria2.

Gli URI sono utilizzati per il Web-seeding. Per i torrent con un singolo file, l\'URI può puntare alla risorsa; se l\'URI termina con /, il nome del file torrent sarà aggiunto. Per torrent con più file, nome e percorso saranno aggiunti per un URI per ogni file.
Nessuna statistica verrà inviata allo sviluppatore
Statistiche riguardo il comportamento dell\'applicazione verranno inviate allo sviluppatore. (Nessun dato personale verrà inviato)
Sono dispiaciuto per l\'inconveniente e sarei grato se inviassi un report dell\'accaduto!\nLo sviluppatore
